Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures.
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is preferred.
Experience with Azure or AWS hosted Cloud environments and Web Services is preferred.
Experience with a version control management system (i.e. Git) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

Overview:
NV5 (NASDAQ: NVEE) is a provider of engineering and consulting services to public and private sector clients, delivering solutions through six business verticals: Testing, Inspection & Consulting; Infrastructure; Utility Services; Environmental Health Sciences; Buildings & Program Management; and Geospatial Technology. With offices nationwide and abroad, NV5 helps clients plan, design, build, test, certify, and operate projects that improve the communities where we live and work.

As engineers, architects, construction/program managers, environmental professionals and beyond, we play a significant role in shaping our communities through the services we provide. We are looking for passionate, driven individuals to join our team focused on Delivering Solutions and Improving Lives.

Job Summary:
The Software Developer Intern will contribute to the company by working closely with internal employees to improve, extend, and debug existing internal applications. The intern will work directly with the IT Manager to learn about the software development lifecycle, from coding to testing to deployment.

Provide end-user support for internal applications.

NV5 offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance, PTO, 401(k) and professional development/advancement opportunities.

NV5 provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, creed, citizenship status, ancestry, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Full Job Description
To reinvent an industry, you have to build the best team. Join Formlabs if you want to bring groundbreaking professional 3D printers to the desktop of every designer, engineer, researcher, and artist in the world.

Formlabs' web team designs and maintains our websites which provide our customers with compelling learning and shopping experiences. We also empower internal users with the tools to manage website content and experiences. We are looking for a curious and motivated intern to help us create data-driven and user-centric experiences for our website.

If you're passionate about driving projects to help solve customer problems, and want to work with a remarkable, interdisciplinary team building a 3D printing ecosystem, we want you on the Form Team as a Software Product Management Intern. You will report to the Software Product Manager for our Websites.

The Job:
Work with stakeholders and various teams to research, gather requirements, design and vet new features for the website.
Define requirements for our development team and then coordinate testing of new features.
Create reporting and analyse the success of new features in order to quickly iterate or test new hypotheses.
Coordinate and prioritize incoming website feature requests or bug fixes from stakeholders.
Analyse data quality and set up reporting for key website metrics and features.
Participate in, and contribute to improvements in, the Web team's scrum ceremonies.

You:
Strong track record of academic excellence in a BA/BS program, majoring in Economics, Finance, Business Administration, Computer Science, Data Science, Math, Physics, Statistics or other technical field. First-year MBA candidates preferred.
Comfortable in a data-driven business environment.
Knowledge of SQL and skilled in Excel and/or Google Sheets.
Ability to think and perform both tactically and strategically.
Strong track record of success with progression in level of responsibility and scope.
Ability to multitask, and pivot readily and react to real-time data.
Excellent interpersonal and team building skills.
Excited to join an experienced team and work on high impact projects.

Bonus:
Familiarity with Test and Learn practices.
Exposure to the agile software development lifecycle.
Experience building reporting in Tableau or similar tools.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Even if you don't check every box, but see yourself contributing, please apply. Help us build an inclusive community that will change the face of 3D printing.

Full Job Description
Typical Day in the Life

A typical day as an Audit Intern (full-time, August through November)﻿ -- SOC (System and Organization Control) at Eide Bailly might include the following:

  • Attend client meetings with a service organization to determine the testing plan for their internal controls, including operation and information technology controls.
  • Prepare a SOC report through a paperless environment.
  • Attend meetings with Eide Bailly staff, managers and partners regarding planning for future SOC engagements, performing current SOC engagements and wrapping up prior SOC engagements.
Who You Are

  • You are inquisitive and enjoy learning about various client business processes and traveling to different locations to help clients (25-50 percent travel is required in the role).
  • You like the challenge of working on SOC engagements and helping clients succeed.
  • You are a multi-tasking master, and there has never been a deadline you could not meet.
  • You have interest in a variety of industries.
  • You hold yourself to the highest professional standards and maintain strict client confidentiality.
  • In addition to all of this, you are working toward a bachelor's degree in Accounting and/or Information Technology - and are on track to sit for your CPA license.
What To Expect Next

We'll be in touch! If you look like the right fit for our position, one of our recruiters will be reaching out to schedule a phone interview with you to learn more about your career interests and goals. In the meantime, we encourage you to check us out on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn or our About Us page.

#LI-DNP

Who We Are

Eide Bailly is one of the top 25 CPA and business advisory firms in the nation. We have over 40 offices in 14 states across the Midwest and western United States, and offer our staff and Partners the opportunity to serve a variety of industries. Founded in 1917, our culture is the foundation of who we are, and we pride ourselves on supporting our employees to help them achieve their goals and pursue their interests both in the office and at home. At Eide Bailly we are passionate about the clients we serve, the work we do, and most importantly, having fun while we do it!

Why You'll Love Working Here

At Eide Bailly we believe respect is how to treat everyone, not just those you want to impress. Our culture focuses on collaboration to achieve career growth. We promote happy employees by making work/life balance a priority along with being actively involved in our communities. Our dedication to service can be seen through the Firm's decision to match charitable donations made by employees, as well as providing opportunities to volunteer throughout the year. Most importantly, we like to have fun! We offer a professional and fun work environment with frequent free lunches, snacks, lunch and learns, socials, contests, outings and other events.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

position: 2022 Trading and Portfolio Finance Summer Analyst
description:
Full Job Description
AQR Capital Management

AQR is a global investment firm built at the intersection of financial theory and practical application. We strive to deliver concrete, long-term results by looking past market noise to identify and isolate the factors that matter most, and by developing ideas that stand up to rigorous testing. By putting theory into practice, we have become a leader in alternative strategies and an innovator in traditional portfolio management since 1998.

At AQR, our employees share a common spirit of academic excellence, intellectual honesty and an unwavering commitment to seeking the truth. We're determined to know what makes financial markets tick – and we'll ask every question and challenge every assumption. We recognize and respect the power of collaboration and believe transparency and openness to new ideas leads to innovation.

The Internship Program

Our 10-week summer program puts real work of the firm in your hands. You will work alongside brilliant people, gain insights and know-how from our Quanta Academy Summer Term curriculum, and experience what it's like to work at the pinnacle of global, systematic investing.

Learning is the cornerstone of our culture and plays an active role in the internship experience — through daily collaboration and interaction with employees at all levels, in workshops and classes, and most significantly by working on projects that matter to the many clients we serve. Our unique AQR Quanta Academy: Summer Term learning series, a structured program, consists of over 40 hours of educational, skill-building and networking events.

The Team

The Trading and Financing team is responsible for efficient trade execution of AQR's investment strategies. The team is comprised of traders, trading assistants, trading infrastructure and trading algorithm developers as well as market microstructure and short-term signal researchers. The department:

Is Responsible for all the firm's global trading on exchanges, SEFs and OTC markets

Develops and evaluates algorithmic trading methodologies in many asset classes

Performs transaction cost analysis in markets that the firm transacts in and builds cost forecasting models for use in AQR's investment strategies

Assists Portfolio Implementation and Research Teams in the management of portfolios and the refinement of the investment process

The Portfolio Finance team consists of highly dynamic and multi-faceted professionals with extensive experience at both buy-side and sell-side firms. As one of the most recently formed and actively growing departments at AQR, Portfolio Finance has three primary responsibilities:

Optimizing the traditional and synthetic financing utilization of the firm across all the breath of asset classes traded by the firm, including associated collateral requirements, instrument types (i.e., derivatives or securities), and investment strategies

Investing and portfolio management of domestic and foreign, cash and cash-equivalent instruments

Managing AQR's critical relationships and numerous touchpoints with the largest firms on Wall Street.

Your Role

We are seeking exceptionally talented individuals to join our Trading and Financing team as interns. Candidates should be ambitious and enthusiastic about implementing new ideas, working within the trading desk and with others in the firm to enhance current processes as a self-starter. Interns will experience a 10-week rotational program throughout functions of the team. Interns will fully immerse in the daily functions of high touch and electronic execution trading, portfolio finance, business management and trade support teams. A rotation through some subset of these functions is planned in order to expose the candidate to multiple functions of the team. You will work in a collaborative environment and on an individual capstone project throughout the summer. Mentorship and constructive performance review will be a focus throughout your time as you work towards earning a full-time role.

What You'll Bring

December 2022 or Winter/Spring 2023 graduate in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Business, Engineering, or scientific related field

Well-organized, detail-oriented, and strong verbal and written communication skills

Hard-working and eager to learn in a highly intellectual, collaborative environment

Demonstrated interest in finance, economics, and capital markets

Strong technical/quantitative skills

Computer science/programming skills preferred

AQR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. EEO/VET/DISABILITY

Full Job Description
Mechanical Engineer Intern-TUC01066

Description

BOMBARDIER

At Bombardier, our employees work together to evolve mobility worldwide - one good idea at a time. If you have a good idea, we’ll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.

With an average of over 300 sunny days per year, Bombardier Business Aircraft’s Tucson Service Center is surrounded by stunning mountain ranges and desert landscapes. Celebrating over 40 years of operations in Tucson, Arizona, the service center occupies almost 1 million sq ft of total hangar space and is the largest of Bombardier’s nine aircraft service centers. The facility services both Bombardier commercial and business aircraft. Since its inauguration in 1976, the facility has been located at Tucson International Airport, a strategic location and a key local partner. The 247,000 sq ft Business Aircraft facility is equipped to perform scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, modifications, including interior modifications, avionics installations, customized exterior paint, and Aircraft on Ground (AOG) support for Bombardier Learjet, Challenger and Global aircraft. The Service Center has received certifications from CAAC, FAA, EASA, Argentina (Military), Bermuda, Canada, Cayman Islands, Hong Kong, India, Mexico, Qatar and South Africa.

Bombardier has an exciting opportunity available for a Mechanical Engineer Intern based in Tucson, AZ.

In your role, you will:
  • Assist with interpreting customer specifications, vendor requirements, company/industry standards, FAA/DOT and foreign regulations
  • Assist with determining mechanical equipment, hardware, antenna and system requirements in all types of Bombardier aircraft
  • Assist with investigating design build issues and help develop structural engineering solutions
  • Release temporary engineering to resolve build issues in a timely manner
  • Assist in dispositioning aircraft non-conformances including rework instructions
  • Perform aircraft and engineering drawing investigation and coordination with affected engineering disciplines, Quality assurance and operations manufacturing representatives
  • Coordinate with vendors to resolve installation interface and reliability problems
  • Author engineering to define structural special instructions or restrictions
Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

  • You are currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace, Mechanical or Computer Science Engineering
Please note: Relocation or housing assistance is not available for this position. No visa sponsorship is available for this position,

Bombardier is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, National, or Local Laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.

Your ideas move people.

Full Job Description

Job Description

Company Information

Smarter Grid Solutions (SGS) is a fast-growing technology company that delivers products and services to enable utilities and developers to integrate distributed and renewable energy resources into our electric grid. Our unique Active Network Management (ANM) technology is the only technology of its kind to provide real-time, autonomous control of distributed energy resources, and is the result of over ten years of developing, deploying and proving this unique approach to managing the Smart Grid.

Overview

SGS is seeking a Software Analytics Intern to join our smart grid analytics team. The team is responsible for developing practical paths to operationalizing advanced power systems analytics; this could be battery optimization techniques, ML-based forecasting, or integration with advanced network-model based approaches based on load flow, optimal power flow, or state estimation. All of these power systems techniques can be used to help manage the grid more optimally and pave the way for deeper de-carbonization.

We are looking for a highly motivated student or graduate with excellent software development skills to help build out our analytical capabilities. In this group, you will sit between the world of software development, power systems, and advanced analytics. Your focus will be on helping develop and test software frameworks that give us and our customers confidence that these complex analytics can be safely operationalized. You will be involved in end-to-end software development in a multi-disciplinary environment.

Qualifying Criteria

**Please note we cannot consider applications from candidates who do not meet these criteria.**

You must be either a NY State resident attending or having attended any college or university, regardless of location, within the last 12 months

or

an out of state student, attending or having attended a College or university located in New York State within the last 12 months.

Required Skills

· Strong academic track record in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or similar

· Familiarity with high-level power and energy systems concepts

· Solid experience in modern analytics-friendly languages like Python, Scala, or R

Desired Skills

There are a number of additional desirable attributes that would complement the required skillset:

  • An understanding of power systems analysis
  • Optimization using AMPL, GAMS, or similar
  • AI and ML techniques
  • First principles understanding of algorithms, data structures, and time/space complexity

Anticipated Start Date: Summer 2021.

Duration: Minimum of 6 months.

Salary: Competitive

Job Type: Internship

Location: New York

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

position: College to Corporate IT Internship - Application Development
description:
Full Job Description
Put your technical mind to work

Do you want to work on new technologies? Are you ready to put your classroom experience into action? Vanguard’s College to Corporate Internship Program is an immersive, hands-on experience at one of the world’s leading investment firms. Extensive training, real-world experience, hands-on opportunities and mentorship from professionals will all aid in broadening your technical expertise in Application Development. You’ll receive exposure to a variety of aspects of the software life cycle and positively impact our clients through challenging assignments like LEAN development, UI Design, and cloud computing. Make it count.

In this program you will:
Create high-impact solutions that allow crew to perform at their best and do what’s right for investors
Gain hands-on experience in Agile software development and practice LEAN methodology in a dynamic environment with crew from around the business
Share your insights and make your voice heard in a collaborative and supportive environment
Receive an opportunity to build a network with program managers, alumni, senior leaders and other interns
Participate in developmental activities such as one-on-one feedback sessions, Tips for Success, and Industry Discussions

What it takes

In pursuit of a bachelor's or master's degree with a concentration in computer science, computer engineering, IST, IT, CIS, Security Risk Analysis or related technical/engineering discipline required

Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred

Proven leadership skills

Effective analytical, communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic environment

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position

This position will begin in the summer of 2022 and last approximately 10 weeks.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Full Job Description
Description : IT Customer Service Intern

Reports to : IT Services Manager

Location : Carmel, IN

Semester: Fall 2021

About Protective Insurance

Protective Insurance specializes in marketing and underwriting insurance for the transportation industry. Backed by our successful history and financial strength, we offer diverse, innovative products in the property and casualty insurance market.

The Protective Internship Program

Protective Insurance is proud to offer an internship program that truly prepares students for the workforce. We provide resources to help interns sharpen skills and make meaningful contributions in their departments. In addition to hands-on work and competitive pay at $13 per hour, the following resources are available during fall internships:

Intern mentors provide leadership and valuable feedback in addition to a personalized work plan

Social team building activities and corporate volunteer opportunities

"Lunch & Learn" sessions and leadership development resources

Access to the corporate Fitness Center

Ability to shadow various departments

Position Overview

The Services Organization Tier I responsibilities include providing technical assistance and superb customer service support to internal and external customers related to computer systems, hardware and software.

Responsibilities

Provide Tier 1 Support for all IT products and services to internal and external end users.

Assist with user password requests and printer mapping

Document, track, and monitor customer requests through our ticketing system to ensure timely resolution

Listen, understand and be the voice of the customer

Assist and follow up with end users through the problem solving process

Identify and escalate issues requiring urgent attention or a higher level of knowledge

Assist with other projects and duties as assigned by the IT manager

Skills/Requirements

Pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Computer Information Systems (CIS), Computer Information Technology (CIT), or a related field

Preference will be given to students with junior standing and a minimum GPA of 3.0 based on a 4.0 scale

Availability to work at least 25 hours per standard work week required

Experience with Windows 7, Windows 10 and Microsoft Office 2013 Suite.

Strong organizational, time management and multi-tasking skills

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Effective written and verbal communication skills

Ability to work independently and in a team environment Interact with customers and subject matter experts to comprehend product requirements

Full Job Description
Orolia, the world leader in Resilient Positioning, Navigation and Timing (PNT) solutions, always has great opportunities for students to intern with our company and work side by side with our innovative engineers.

Our Internship Opportunities:
Orolia is looking for Interns enrolled in a four-year or post-graduate degree program in the following fields:

Electrical Engineering
Computer Engineering
Computer Science
Signal Processing
Radio Communications

What you’ll be doing:
Our technology at Orolia is innovative and cutting edge. A typical day could be…

Working closely with Lead Engineers in in a lab environment designing the latest GPS-based and alternative PNT equipment and software

Testing new products, new features and software releases to ensure our products meet the highest standards and specifications.

Devising test procedures, experiments, test fixtures and software; performing those tests, analyzing the results and generating comprehensive test reports and recommendations.

Analyzing and debugging problem reports and designing fixes

Working with vendors, subcontractors, and customers to understand their needs and applications toward solving problems in deployments

Working in a multi-discipline, multi-cultural environmental with cross-functional teams toward a common design goal.

What does it take to be successful at Orolia?

Global Collaboration: We pride ourselves on personal excellence through global collaboration, communication and team achievement!

Fun: We are at our best having fun and we bring the best out of each other.

Innovation: We love to develop and implement creative solutions!

Commitment: We persevere in all situations.

Agility: Our business, strategies and our people are ready to adapt to evolving needs of our markets.

Continuous Improvement: We’re curious and we always demonstrate the desire to improve results and challenge the status quo.

Why Orolia?

Orolia is an international high-tech company dedicated to improving the safety, compliance and efficiency of its global customers’ remote operations by providing them business solutions and services based on the most advanced positioning, navigation, timing, sensing, information, and communications technologies. At Orolia, we continuously look to go “Beyond the Frontier” in everything that we do. As an organization, we strive to be the market leader and look for employees who have the same passion for their personal careers. If you love working in a multicultural environment where being the best is encouraged, Orolia is the employer for you.

Orolia believes that success in the global marketplace requires a variety of perspectives and individual experiences. At Orolia, we understand, appreciate and strive for new and different thoughts and ideas. A high degree of employee involvement, lifelong learning and diversity are permanent items on the agenda throughout the entire organization.

Please note this description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Orolia is an equal opportunity employer who does not discriminate based on race, color, citizenship, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran’s status or any protected category. We encourage veterans and people with disabilities to apply.

Full Job Description
You will be designing and developing the software that will decide the optimal behavior of the autonomous vehicle such as planning future paths, stop-and-go decisions, etc. Projects may include optimizing current path planning/control algorithms in terms of computational complexity, time constraints, program efficiency and solution correctness. You may also take part in brainstorming, researching, programming, implementing and potentially integrating algorithm alternatives to our current path planning and control autonomous algorithms. Your work will be a core part of ThorDrive’s Autonomous Driving technology and you will be expected to meet professional expectations.
Minimum qualifications
Currently pursuing a MS, or PhD degree in CS, EE, CE, automotive engineering, robotics or related fields
Solid C++ skills
Understanding of data structures and algorithms
Experience with robotics middleware ROS (robot operating system)
Basic knowledge of Python
Familiar with Linux environment (Ubuntu)
Team player, good communication and collaboration skills
Preferred experiences
Algorithms (e.g. dijkstra, A*, D*, frenet-frame, RRT)
Hands-on experiences with autonomous vehicles or ground wheel robots
Experience with multi-threaded/multi-process programming
Basic understanding of communication protocols such as CAN
Notes
You will be tested in C++ for the coding assessment

Full Job Description

Machine Learning Engineering Intern: Environmental, Social, Governance (ESG) Investment Model Development

LOCATION: Remote and/or Tysons Corner, VA

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS:

Verstand AI (www.verstand.ai) is seeking interns with an interest in building custom data product and artificial intelligence solutions for clients in the financial services industry. Armed with knowledge of data science applications and machine learning algorithms, the machine learning intern will be instrumental in building high quality datasets to fine tuning models (building and retraining models) for maximizing performance. Along with the management of cloud environments,
Verstand interns will be responsible for ensuring data quality, scoring and evaluation of models, and continuous model operations. Additionally, support will be handed to Data Engineers to build ETL pipelines and BI Designers to design visualizations and dashboards. Knowledge of capital markets and trading strategies an advantage.

Most importantly, Verstand AI's interns will get an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies and be part of data teams that help clients harness the power of artificial intelligence. Verstand’s interns will shape and build efficient and self-learning applications.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work with product owners, data engineers, and BI designers to understand product requirements, data needs, and model design
  • Acquire data and build custom datasets using web-scraping or NLP tools
  • Perform data analysis on large structured or unstructured datasets, using machine learning to enrich data features and data quality
  • Design and build data extraction, transformation, and loading processes by writing custom data pipelines
  • Design, implement and support platforms that can provide ad-hoc access to large datasets and unstructured data
  • Perform model parameter and hyperparameter fine tuning to optimize model learn rates and maximize model performance
  • Participate in feature engineering planning sessions
  • Develop multiple model scoring and evaluation methodologies
  • Design visualizations and dashboards for reporting and rich storytelling

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum Experience, Skills and Education:

  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms, their application for problem solving and MLOps
  • Strong Python, Java, R and SQL skills with understanding of software development
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, and statistics
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Could Platform (GCP)
  • Working knowledge of Python Machine Learning libraries (SciKit Learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras)
  • Experience with base level data Python libraries (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Scapy, NLTK)
  • Working knowledge of scoring and evaluating machine learning models
  • Working knowledge of ETL pipelines and data ingestion methodology
  • Working knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI, Looker and Tableau
  • Effective written/spoken communication skills and strong problem-solving skills
  • Currently enrolled in Bachelor's degree from four-year College or university in Computer Science, Data Science or related field

Experience That Sets You Apart:

  • Experience with capital markets, time series analysis, trading strategies and algorithms
  • Experience and interest in ESG reporting, data points, and standards

Verstand AI is a fast-growing firm that believes in ongoing training and development for its staff. The firm's mission is to help both its commercial and public sector clients resolve data management challenges and move to delivering insight and benefits for stakeholders, customers and constituents.

Based out of Tysons Corner, VA, Verstand does business across the United States and is moving into Europe and Asia. If you're interested in working with us and have a desire to tackle challenging data problems, we welcome your interest and encourage you to apply.

Full Job Description
The Solutions Delivery Intern is part of a multi-semester long professional internship program. The internship will consist of a focused project in the subject area of the internship, working closely with a leader who will mentor you. High preforming interns may be offered full-time positions post-graduation. You will be paid a competitive hourly rate for the internship. In addition, many interns may receive academic credit for their work through their college or university.

What you’ll do

Support day-to-day applications, data, reporting, and analytics projects and complete ad hoc application requests
Provide historical, current, and predictive views of business operations to support key partners in decision making across the enterprise
Build/analyze data sources to understand key drivers of the business
Creatively and rigorously apply modern techniques to a wide range of business problems

What we’re looking for

College Junior or Senior within one to two years of graduation
An interest in pursuing a career with Kum & Go post-graduation
Must be able to complete at least 240 hours during the summer 2021
Must have completed high school in Iowa or currently attend an Iowa community college, private college, or Board of Regents institution

Other key requirements

Pursuing an undergraduate degree in MIS, Computer Science or other STEM major (master’s or doctorate students not eligible)
Detail oriented and process-thinker
Excellent writing and communication skills
Experience in Microsoft Technologies preferred

Leadership Competencies

Communication: Delivers clear, effective communication and listens to others
Conceptual/Systems Thinking: Recognizes patterns, trends, themes, and connections in information to develop innovative ideas and solutions
Constructive Engagement: Expresses ideas and disagreements, constructively resolves conflict, and encourages others to do the same
Customer Orientation: Meets the expectations and needs of internal and external customers
Decision Making: Makes good decisions in a timely manner
Empowerment: Takes initiative and solves problems
Talent Development: Maximizes potential and improves overall performance
Influence: Proactively builds relationships and influences others
Analytical Thinking/Problem Solving: Accurately assesses problems and effectively and efficiently arrives at solutions
Strategic Thinking: Understands the current state and is able to visualize the ideal state and how to achieve it

About Kum & Go

At Kum & Go, our purpose is to make days better. We do that by connecting with people. Every day, whether in stores or at our Store Support Center headquarters, we take a people-first approach to developing associates, serving customers, and solving problems. We provide a unique working experience where associates are given many opportunities to make connections and to have fun along the way. Our culture is supported by our five core values:

Passion - We love what we do, and it shows in our work.
Integrity - We do the right thing, even when it is difficult.
Teamwork - We believe that greatness is only achieved in unity.
Caring - We have genuine compassion for our customers, associates, families, and communities.
Excellence - We expect and deliver superior performance.

For nearly 60 years, Kum & Go has been dedicated to the communities it serves, sharing 10 percent of its profits with charitable causes. For four generations, the family-owned convenience store chain has focused on providing exceptional service and delivering more than customers expect. Established in Hampton, Iowa, in 1959, the chain has since grown to employ more than 5,000 associates in more than 400 stores in 11 states (Iowa, Arkansas, Colorado, Minnesota, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, North Dakota, Oklahoma, South Dakota, and Wyoming).

Kum & Go is an Equal Opportunity Employer

  • Develop novel computer vision and image processing algorithms

Full Job Description
Traditional corporate cards were designed to make you spend more with complex rewards programs that encourage wasteful spending. In contrast, Ramp’s mission is to increase the lifespan of businesses with intelligence & automation designed for high-performing finance teams. We make financial rigor easy by enabling real-time visibility and understanding of every dollar spent. Over 1,000 customers are now using Ramp for over $1 billion in annualized transaction volume.

Ramp was founded in 2019 by the same team who built, scaled, and sold Paribus to Capital One. We are the fastest growing NYC startup, having achieved a unicorn valuation of $1.6 billion in less than 2 years. Ramp has raised $320 million in funding from investors including Stripe, Goldman Sachs, Founders Fund, Coatue Management, D1 Capital Partners and Thrive Capital, as well as over 50 angel investors who were founders or executives of leading companies.

About the Role

Ramp is, at its core, an engineering company, and is on a mission to build the best engineering team in NYC! We are looking for frontend and full stack engineering interns (12 weeks) who are excited to be part of our early story and help us build a diverse and vibrant tech community in the city. We hire engineers with a broad set of technical skills, who are highly cross-functional, and eager to solve a wide range of engineering challenges. Our ideal candidate has a strong sense of ownership and enjoys owning projects from inception to scaling it in production. We value people who take pride in their work, and show an aptitude for learning quickly whether they’re familiar with our stack or not. As an early employee, you'll be working with a nimble team of committed and talented engineers and having a large, long-term impact on technical design and engineering culture.

What You'll Do

Build performant, beautiful, and usable interfaces that solve for growing businesses with complex needs
Ship products and services in cross-functional teams
Work with sales and business teams to incorporate and productize customer feedback
Help establish engineering process, tools, and systems that will allow us to scale the code base, productivity, and the team

What You'll Need

Currently pursuing a B.S. (or higher) in Computer Science or a related technical field, with an expected graduation date in 2021 or 2022
Proficiency in Javascript, with a knack for getting the visuals right
Experience with one or more object-oriented programming languages
Track record of shipping high quality products and features or a portfolio of side projects
Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow, and master your craft
Alignment with Ramp’s core values of enabling businesses to grow more by spending less

Nice to Haves

Proficiency in React v16+
Familiarity with or desire to learn our tech stack which includes, but not limited to: Flask (Python), Elixir, AWS, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL
Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology

About Our Teams

Card Engineering | Ramp’s Card Engineering team is responsible for shipping products with a singular focus on enhancing the finance team and cardholder experience. Current project areas include accounting, physical/virtual card management, mobile wallets, transactions, reimbursements, spend insights, and vendor/invoice management.
Risk Engineering | Ramp’s Risk Engineering team is pioneering how risk is evaluated and building the infrastructure to scale to millions of business in the United States. Current project areas include application processing, underwriting & KYC, risk data signals, risk limit & exposure management, bank linking, capital markets, fraud, and payments.

Learn more about our problem space and environment at our new engineering blog!

Ramp Benefits

Unlimited PTO
WFH stipend to support your home office needs
Monthly wellness stipend

Networking services and Telecommunications

In this program, you will

Create high-impact solutions that allow crew to perform at their best and do what’s right for investors

Share your insights and make your voice heard in a collaborative and supportive environment
Receive an opportunity to build a network with program managers, alumni, senior leaders and other interns
Participate in developmental activities such as one-on-one feedback sessions, Tips for Success, and Industry Discussions

As an intern, you will build skills using some of the latest technology

Databases: DB2, Oracle, SQL Server
Platforms/Servers: zOS, Solaris, Windows, Linux, Web and Application.NET, Spring, Web Services, Web, Mobile apps (iOS, Android)
Languages/Tools: Java, JSF, Ajax, JavaScript, C/C++/C#, XML, XSLT, HTML, XHTML, CSS, Cobol, Maven, Hudson, Subversion, Nexus, JTest, Sharepoint, AngularJS, Selenium
Concepts: Distributed systems, Tiered development, Data Driven decision making. Service Oriented Architecture, responsive design, Automated Testing

What it takes

In pursuit of a bachelor's or master's degree with a concentration in computer science, computer engineering, IST, IT, CIS, Security Risk Analysis or related technical/engineering discipline required

Proven leadership skills
Effective analytical, communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic environment

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position

This position will begin in the summer of 2022 and last approximately 10 weeks.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Job Description

Company Information

Smarter Grid Solutions (SGS) is a fast-growing technology company that delivers products and services to enable utilities and developers to integrate distributed and renewable energy resources into our electric grid. Our unique Active Network Management (ANM) technology is the only technology of its kind to provide real-time, autonomous control of distributed energy resources, and is the result of over ten years of developing, deploying and proving this unique approach to managing the Smart Grid.

Overview

SGS is seeking a Software Analytics Intern to join our smart grid analytics team. The team is responsible for developing practical paths to operationalizing advanced power systems analytics; this could be battery optimization techniques, ML-based forecasting, or integration with advanced network-model based approaches based on load flow, optimal power flow, or state estimation. All of these power systems techniques can be used to help manage the grid more optimally and pave the way for deeper de-carbonization.

We are looking for a highly motivated student or graduate with excellent software development skills to help build out our analytical capabilities. In this group, you will sit between the world of software development, power systems, and advanced analytics. Your focus will be on helping develop and test software frameworks that give us and our customers confidence that these complex analytics can be safely operationalized. You will be involved in end-to-end software development in a multi-disciplinary environment.

Qualifying Criteria

**Please note we cannot consider applications from candidates who do not meet these criteria.**

You must be either a NY State resident attending or having attended any college or university, regardless of location, within the last 12 months

or

an out of state student, attending or having attended a College or university located in New York State within the last 12 months.

Required Skills

· Strong academic track record in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or similar

· Familiarity with high-level power and energy systems concepts

· Solid experience in modern analytics-friendly languages like Python, Scala, or R

Desired Skills

There are a number of additional desirable attributes that would complement the required skillset:

  • An understanding of power systems analysis
  • Optimization using AMPL, GAMS, or similar
  • AI and ML techniques
  • First principles understanding of algorithms, data structures, and time/space complexity

Anticipated Start Date: Summer 2021.

Duration: Minimum of 6 months.

Salary: Competitive

Job Type: Internship

Location: New York

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $17.00 per hour

'All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.'

US Citizens and all other parties authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply.
From: Ribbon Communications

Full Job Description
Company Description

Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.

Job Description

Square's Hardware Team builds the tangible connection to Square. We started with a simple Reader that turns any phone or tablet into a mobile point of sale - and we continue to lead this category with advances in technologies that define point of sale hardware (NFC, display, WiFi, Bluetooth, touch). Our hardware engineers design and develop outstanding hardware products. They understand the subtleties of user interaction, robust communication interfaces, and smart product design.

For this 12-week remote internship, you will:
Become intimately familiar with Square's hardware products and manufacturing processes.
Research technologies for our next-generation hardware products.
As part of the Systems Engineering track, you will develop device characterization plans and measurement-setup prototypes for new technologies.
As part of the Electrical Design Engineering track, you will help design and test electrical systems for new Square hardware products
Work with Square's Devices Software Engineering group to understand embedded test access and APIs.
Write and debug engineering automation software for the lab and the factory.
Reach beyond boundaries to make Square's products better wherever you see the chance

Qualifications

You are:
Pursuing a degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field, graduating between May 2022 and June 2024.
Familiar with Python, MATLAB, or similar programming language
Experience with EE schematics and PCB layout
EE skills including switch mode power supplies, amplifiers, microcontrollers, batteries and charging systems, and high speed digital signals.
Familiar with hardware lab equipment for test, measurement (e.g. oscilloscope, power supply, function generator, spectrum analyzer, DMM), or prototyping (Soldering, Raspberry Pi, Arduino, 3D printing, powertools)
Excited to work on hands-on projects and to make things work in EE or software realms
Eager to apply engineering skills to dig into challenges that are outside of your expertise.
You're collaborative and excited to work as part of a team, ask questions, and share information to solve problems.

Even better:
Experience measurement systems automation.
Knowledgeable of statistics
Familiar with the co-existence of multiple technologies in a unified system.
Experience with Altium Schematic and PCB design tools

Additional Information

At Square, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

position: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 286555
Work Area: Software-Development Operations
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Project:
The SAP Internship Experience Project is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Project in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
The SAP Digital Platforms team, within SAP’s Intelligence Enterprise Solutions group, is responsible for SAP.com and associated external (public-facing) digital web properties. The SAP Digital Platforms team is responsible for the development lifecycle, continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices, and overall operational support for 47 country sites globally in 23 languages.

The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is a detail-oriented, in-house services team that is constantly pushing the envelope by working within our creative and technical boundaries to encourage internal customers to build the best user-experiences and blazing-fast websites.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
Location: Newtown Square, PA
Expected start date to end date: July 2021 - January 2022

In this role, you’ll:
The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is looking for an Intern to assist the Speed Performance Monitoring Lead to collaborate with the design, development, and other operational leads for SAP‘s digital landscapes. Our on-going objective to improve the online responsiveness of our user-experience on desktop and mobile web browsers in support of SAP’s 2021 Mobile-First strategy.

This role is responsible for assisting in the management of SAP.com and other digital entities including communications, content and assets for various areas of the global website and digital programs. The position provides a main point of contact for assigned requests, driving projects to completion through close collaboration with core platform team members, leadership, and assigned third-party agencies to ensure efficient and timely production of a high-quality digital customer experience.

Who you are:
We're looking for a self-motivated, out-of-the-box thinker who enjoys challenges across a broad range of technology subject areas, is pursuing a career in Computer Science, Front-End Web Development, or User-Experience Design with knowledge and interest in performance and optimization, front-end development, interactive design, application performance industry, and enterprise level projects.

Responsibilities

Audit websites for performance, identify optimization opportunities, and present the results in the cross-functional team environment.
Work in a collaborative environment developing and executing against immediate and long-term incremental programs.
Make effective tradeoffs considering business priorities, but always with the user-experience in mind.
Advise web engineering teams on key technical performance and optimization considerations and best practices.
Work with Data/Analytics team on ensure assets are trackable for reporting and insights initiatives.
Profile performance of JavaScript and layouts for a multitude of devices/platforms.
Work with partners (e.g.: Adobe, Splunk, Google, and other third-party web services) and consulting agencies to ensure each site release or initiative delivers maximum impact to customers across all websites and data platforms.
Generate performance reports, competitive analysis, and benchmarks for internal partners using our best-in-class performance and optimization tool-sets.
Build out and report on synthetic tests with Splunk (a.k.a. Rigor) Synthetic Testing platform.
Build out available real-user monitoring test reports with SAP.com Development Team.
Analyze performance metrics and build plans for improvements with development leads.
Provide an unparalleled customer experience by contributing to new features and technical documentation.
Assist with discovering and debugging issues found on web properties.
Find areas we can optimistically render UI without waiting on a server response.
Police and standardize performance budgets, health-checks, scorecards, and KPIs directed by your main point of contact.
Monitor and measure complex multi-step user flows on our customers’ websites and applications using a full browser and a script recorder.
Track mobile and desktop experiences and performance over time using pre-determined, industry standard network connections.
Monitor and optimize third-party tags and identify slow and error-causing external script risks.
Run tests with highly customizable configurations on any device type, connection speed or viewport
Develop, share, and set the bar within SAP for high quality in web performance engineering.
Assist in the support of planning and project management.
Assist building internal webpages in SAP JAM, Microsoft Teams, and other wiki-based platforms for documentation and communication in support of SAP’s Speed Performance Monitoring program.
Help organize projects in accordance with requirements.
Assist with SAP.com agile ceremonies and planning.
Leverage tools and technology for SAP.com content and asset production.
Have very good communication skills and enjoy communicating challenging technical concepts.
Measure and A/B test site performance solutions.
Mentor, educate and advocate for web performance across our teams.

Qualifications

General knowledge of web speed performance metrics.
General familiarity with Internet technologies and how the web works.
General knowledge of industry standard web speed performance tools; e.g.: WebPageTest.org, Google Pagespeed Insights, and Google Lighthouse.
General to Intermediate knowledge, approx. 1-2 years, of general web technologies experience; e.g.: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Java/C#/PHP.
Intermediate knowledge of Google Core Web Vitals strategy and metric threshold requirements.
Intermediate knowledge of visual design principles and commonly used tools for optimizing visual page elements; e.g.: images and media.
Have the ability to read and understand code, explore new technologies, and APIs.
General knowledge of modern browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
General knowledge of project management and, issue tracking and documentation tools; e.g.: JIRA, Confluence, MS Teams, Slack, etc.
Proficiency with converting JSON to MS Excel for in-depth speed performance reporting.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs; including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Comfortable working with a geographically-distributed software development team.
Willingness to acquire new skills to meet evolving needs.
Passion and interest in web performance optimization to improve an website’s user-experience across all web devices, internet connection speeds, and geo-locations.
Exceptional organizational and planning skills and a proven ability to multi-task.
General knowledge of Agile methodologies.
General understanding of content management systems such as WordPress or Adobe AEM.
Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills.
Attention to detail with an emphasis on accuracy and quality.
Ability to prioritize effectively to manage multiple projects.
Experience working in a team environment as well as independently.
Ability to collaborate across teams globally.
Ability to complete tasks in a timely manner.
Strong desire to continually learn new technologies.

Technical Experience

A basic knowledge is required for this internship.

Intermediate expertise is required for future employment opportunities.

Full-stack Development
HTML5/CSS3
JavaScript
JavaScript Frameworks
jQuery
DevTools
Responsive/Adaptive Design
Cross-Browser Development
Content Management Systems
Testing/Debugging
Git/Version Control

Bonus Skills:
Solid hands-on understanding of Google Analytics, CDNs and custom HTTP headers.
Intermediate knowledge of advanced web performance profiling tools; e.g.: GTmetrix, Pingdom, SpeedCurve, Rigor, etc.
Experience optimizing React applications.
Knowledge of code splitting and simplification methods.

Education and Professional Experience

In pursuit of degree in a related field or equivalent work experience; such topics of interests are:
Computer Science
Web Performance Analytics
Full Stack Web Development
Front-End Web Development
User-Experience Design
Interactive Design and Media
Marketing & Business
Relevant experience in study or similar position managing production processes and workflow.
Relevant experience in study or similar position monitoring quality assurance testing environments and live production systems.

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

Becht is a company founded on excellence, and as such we seek individuals who want to be part of our passionate and energetic team.

Who Do We Want?

At Becht, our intern/co-op program gives students the opportunity to explore the practical applications of their college classes while working with customers from around the globe. We offer full-time student positions for every semester. These positions actively support current projects and are constantly evolving. As a student with Becht, you will learn to develop internal and client facing web apps, web pages, and productivity tools with a team of other software developers and engineers. You will be involved in the entire process from setting application requirements, creating data models, and designing the interface, developing the front and back ends, testing and assisting in deployment. You will be at the forefront of our most advanced and technically rewarding projects to assist clients in improving reliability and profitability while also reducing risks to people and the environment.

Build Your Career with Becht

Measure what Matters: We take the customer’s perspective, our “True North”, both to measure what matters

us to proactively avoid problems.

Empower Teams: We move decision making as close to the customer as possible and provide the structure and

Steadily Improve: We leverage a common and proven set of lean-based tools to prioritize our biggest

opportunities, address those opportunities at root cause, and quickly implement change.

Always Learn: We ensure that improvements are sustained, enabling us to raise performance expectations and

repeat the cycle of improvement. Equally, this cycle strengthens the Mesa team by providing endless learning

opportunities for our employees and helps us to become an employer of choice in our communities.

Job Description

Company Information

Smarter Grid Solutions (SGS) is a fast-growing technology company that delivers products and services to enable utilities and developers to integrate distributed and renewable energy resources into our electric grid. Our unique Active Network Management (ANM) technology is the only technology of its kind to provide real-time, autonomous control of distributed energy resources, and is the result of over ten years of developing, deploying and proving this unique approach to managing the Smart Grid.

Overview

SGS is seeking a Software Analytics Intern to join our smart grid analytics team. The team is responsible for developing practical paths to operationalizing advanced power systems analytics; this could be battery optimization techniques, ML-based forecasting, or integration with advanced network-model based approaches based on load flow, optimal power flow, or state estimation. All of these power systems techniques can be used to help manage the grid more optimally and pave the way for deeper de-carbonization.

We are looking for a highly motivated student or graduate with excellent software development skills to help build out our analytical capabilities. In this group, you will sit between the world of software development, power systems, and advanced analytics. Your focus will be on helping develop and test software frameworks that give us and our customers confidence that these complex analytics can be safely operationalized. You will be involved in end-to-end software development in a multi-disciplinary environment.

Qualifying Criteria

**Please note we cannot consider applications from candidates who do not meet these criteria.**

You must be either a NY State resident attending or having attended any college or university, regardless of location, within the last 12 months

or

an out of state student, attending or having attended a College or university located in New York State within the last 12 months.

Required Skills

· Strong academic track record in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or similar

· Familiarity with high-level power and energy systems concepts

· Solid experience in modern analytics-friendly languages like Python, Scala, or R

Desired Skills

There are a number of additional desirable attributes that would complement the required skillset:

  • An understanding of power systems analysis
  • Optimization using AMPL, GAMS, or similar
  • AI and ML techniques
  • First principles understanding of algorithms, data structures, and time/space complexity

Anticipated Start Date: Summer 2021.

Duration: Minimum of 6 months.

Salary: Competitive

Job Type: Internship

Location: New York

Pay: $17.00 per hour

Full Job Description
Are you a budding product designer who puts the user first? Do you desire to see your work have a measurable business impact? We're looking for product design interns to join our Growth & Analytics Team who want to break into the burgeoning field of Growth Design. This role is equal parts design and research, with a good measure of front-end development.

What You'll Be Doing:
Collaborating with the Growth & Analytics Team to discover lightweight, high-impact UX & UI enhancements to advance key growth metrics.
Analyzing user experience flows and participating in user research to reveal pain points and find areas for improvement.
Writing research plans with evidence and hypotheses and designing measurable experiments to test possible solutions.
Building A/B & Multivariate experiments in the InfluxDB Cloud application that are powered by Google Optimize.
Measuring the impact of experiments and presenting the results to stakeholders in a way that proves the ROI on user experience enhancements.

What You'll Bring To The Table:
Be pursuing a master's-level degree relevant to the field of design, computer science, or social science research
A strong visual aesthetic — you have an eye for what beautiful UI looks like
Product design knowledge and experience demonstrated in a design portfolio
Knowledge of user testing methods and tools and ethical research principles
Front-End development skills in HTML, CSS, & JavaScript
A passion for rapid testing and data-driven decision making
Familiarity with trends in the SaaS industry

Bonus Points:
Experience with Typescript, React, & SASS
Experience with using UI libraries
Google Optimize, Google Tag Manager, and Google Analytics experience
Desire to build skills in design, engineering, and research

It's not expected that you'll have deep expertise in every dimension above, but you should be interested in learning any of the areas that are less familiar.

InfluxData is the creator of InfluxDB, the leading open source time series database. We are a Series D-funded startup, backed by Sapphire Ventures, Norwest Venture Partners, Mayfield Fund, Trinity Ventures, and Battery Ventures, and a Y Combinator success story.

InfluxData's workforce is distributed throughout the U.S. and across Europe. The company was recently named one of the 50 Best Workplaces for Innovators by Fast Company.

Our technology is purpose-built to handle the massive volumes of time-stamped data produced by IoT devices, applications, networks, containers and computers. We are on a mission to help developers and organizations, such as Cisco, IBM, PayPal, and Tesla, store and analyze real-time data, empowering them to build transformative monitoring, analytics, and IoT applications quicker and to scale.

Our Core Values

Our employees are the heart of the company and only by having a core set of beliefs and values will we be successful. We hire and live by these core values:

We value each other
We get stuff done
We believe humility drives learning
We embrace failure
We are committed to open source

Visit our careers page to learn more about working at InfluxData.

InfluxData is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

InfluxData does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters and recruitment agencies through our website, job board or directly to employees. InfluxData will not pay fees to any third-party agency, headhunter or company that does not have a signed agreement for this position in place.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. description:
Full Job Description

Software Engineering Intern, Cloud Applications

*
Experience: Pursuing or Graduated BS or MS Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, with Sophomore, Junior or Senior level standing
*
*
Location: Chicago, IL USA Company Headquarters (Hybrid Work Model)
*
*
Role Description: Maximal is looking for a Software Engineer Intern who is motivated to work closely with a talented and diverse engineering group to bring hardware and software together to deliver end customer products. The candidate will work very closely with senior software and hardware engineers to design and stand up custom software solutions, and exhibit strong cultural values that put the customer first, go beyond the standard, show strong ownership, innovate further, and show strong people skills.
*
*
Company Description: Maximal is an engineering design firm based out of mHub, the largest hardtech incubator in America. The company works in a highly collaborative, interdisciplinary, and cross-functional environment working with engineers and designers of all backgrounds to stand up the most innovative solutions in the shortest time and the most efficient use of resources. Our work spans across industries including automotive, additive and subtractive manufacturing, consumer, industrial, IoT, mobile, wearables and more. Maximal designs systems and key components for Fortune 500 companies and other industry leaders to enable workflow optimizations, higher quality production, lower incident rates, and a smile on the customers face. The Company supports product teams within large and small companies to bring their products to market, optimize existing designs, and plan product market strategy. Maximal has an energetic, purpose-driven work environment built by phenomenal founders who go beyond expectations, are highly curious, deeply innovative and, above all, put customers first.
*
*
PRIMARY FUNCTION:

  • Work on software to interact with cloud based solutions
  • Support the software development effort – from spec development to software delivery – of product-ready
  • Interact with Project Leads to integrate Maximal’s solution for connected systems

*

*
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work with Project Lead to develop features that have a high degree of hardware/software interaction
  • Develop re-usable, scalable, and testable embedded software that can be easily adopted into a diverse range of products
  • Work collaboratively with strategic cloud partners to integrate cloud and IoT software solutions
  • Establish and maintain software timelines to ensure timely delivery of products
  • Contribute to the development of Intellectual Property

*
*
ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

  • Candidate must have educational experience with writing software for cloud based applications
  • Strong written & verbal communications skills, and good interpersonal skills
  • Ability to understand software state machines and interactions with embedded systems
  • Demonstrated success in resolution of technical challenges leveraging strong problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work individually and in small teams
  • Experience using version control systems such as Github and SVN

*
*
PREFERABLE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS

  • Experience with software verification & testing
  • Familiarity with MES/PLC systems a HUGE plus
  • Python, Bash scripting experience
  • Linux experience

*
